p.o: Oh bring my brother back to me, I cannot play alone. The spring has come with flowers and bees, Where has my brother gone?
What would you like to be when you grow up?
We’ll now read your ... what you’ve written down. Donald John,
Would you please read what’s on your slate?
I would like to be a soldier, and march and fight in Cape Wrath.
There came a poor widow from Sunderland, with all the children in her hand, some could knit and some could sew, and some could knead the lily-white dough. Please take one in.
Now my Mary she is gone, she is gone, she is gone, now my Mary she is gone, goodbye Mary, goodbye, goodbye.
